ACT
171
Keeping the statement of the oral will
If witnesses to an oral will have submitted a statement about the testator's will to the court or notary public, he will establish the identity of the witnesses, and then record the receipt of their statement, place it in a special envelope and seal it.
The same will be done when the witnesses of the oral will come to the court or notary public to repeat the testator's statement orally.
On the occasion of taking the statements of the witnesses of the oral will, the court, or the notary public, will try to determine the statement of the testator's will, and will also examine the circumstances on which the validity of the oral will depends.
Documents on an oral will will be kept separately from other files.
